description.narrative: [Inactive] Salaries and related costs for Programme Support, which contributes to Child Health, Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Hiv Prevention, Hygiene, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Nutrition And Hiv, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: At least 80 per cent of pregnant women, new-borns and children less than five years of age and adolescents have access to high- impact quality maternal, new-born, child and adolescent health interventions including HIV and AIDS with a special focus on the most disadvantaged districts and communities.

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Community and home based maternal and newborn care
Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)
IMNCI / Integrated Community Case Management (iCCM) - Community
Immunization supply chain, including cold chain
PMTCT program support such as retention in care, family planning, infant feeding, infant medical male circumcision and community facility linkages

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
